meta.name: Track Technology Stacks & Find Decision Makers with BuiltWith to Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## ðŸ§© SECTION 1: **ðŸ”˜ Manual Start + ðŸ“ Set Target Technology**

### ðŸŽ¯ Purpose:

This section allows **you (the user)** to manually start the workflow and specify **which technology** (e.g., Shopify, WordPress, React) you're interested in searching for via BuiltWith.

### ðŸ”¹ Nodes:

* **ðŸ”˜ Manual Trigger** (`Manual Trigger`)
  âž¤ This lets you run the workflow manually while testing or for one-time actions.
  ðŸ“ Tip: Great for workflows that don't need to run on a schedule.

* **ðŸ“ Set Technology** (`Set` Node)
  âž¤ You manually define the **technology name** here (e.g., "Shopify").
  âž¤ You can add a field like:

  ```json
  {
    "technologies": "Shopify"
  }
  ```

  âœ… This makes the workflow dynamic â€” you can change the tech each time without editing multiple nodes.

### ðŸ”° What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **Manual Trigger** to run a test or ad-hoc job.
* How to use the **Set Node** to insert static/custom data into the flow.
* How workflows can be made flexible with variables like `technologies`.

---

## ðŸ”— SECTION 2: **ðŸŒ Fetch + ðŸ§  Process BuiltWith Data**

### ðŸŽ¯ Purpose:

Use the HTTP Request node to connect with the BuiltWith API, and then process the JSON response to extract useful data about the websites.

### ðŸ”¹ Nodes:

* **ðŸŒ Fetch BuiltWith Data** (`HTTP Request`)
  âž¤ Sends a `GET` request to BuiltWithâ€™s API to find websites using the selected technology.
  âž¤ Example URL:

  ```
  https://api.builtwith.com/v20/api.json?KEY=YOUR_API_KEY&TECH=Shopify&START=0
  ```

  ðŸ”‘ Make sure to replace `YOUR_API_KEY` with your real BuiltWith API key.

* **ðŸ§  Extract Site Info** (`Function` Node)
  âž¤ This node parses the JSON response from BuiltWith and pulls out the key fields:

  * `domain`
  * `technology`
  * `firstIndexed`
  * `vertical`
    âž¤ Example output (ready for sheets):

  ```json
  {
    "domain": "www.example-shop.com",
    "technology": "Shopify",
    "firstIndexed": "2024-11-02",
    "vertical": "E-commerce"
  }
  ```

### ðŸ”° What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **HTTP Request** node to work with any public API.
* How to read API documentation (BuiltWith) and form queries.
* How to process complex API responses using a **Function Node** to extract and clean data.

---

## ðŸ“Š SECTION 3: **ðŸ“„ Log to Google Sheets**

### ðŸŽ¯ Purpose:

Store the clean data into a Google Sheet so that it can be used for:

* Lead generation
* Email campaigns
* Technology tracking
* Competitor research

### ðŸ”¹ Node:

* **ðŸ“„ Log to Google Sheet** (`Google Sheets â†’ Append`)
  âž¤ Appends the parsed data from the previous step to your spreadsheet.
  âž¤ Each row represents a different website using the technology.
  âž¤ Example columns:

  * A: Domain
  * B: Technology
  * C: First Indexed
  * D: Vertical

ðŸ” Youâ€™ll authenticate this once using Google OAuth2 â€” n8n saves the connection for future runs.

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## ðŸŒŸ n8n BuiltWith â†’ Google Sheets Lead Generation Workflow

> ðŸ”Ž Goal: Use the BuiltWith API to find websites using a specific technology (e.g., Shopify) and log that data into Google Sheets for lead generation, prospecting, or analysis.

---

## ðŸ§© SECTION 1: **ðŸ”˜ Manual Start + ðŸ“ Set Target Technology**

### ðŸŽ¯ Purpose:

This section allows **you (the user)** to manually start the workflow and specify **which technology** (e.g., Shopify, WordPress, React) you're interested in searching for via BuiltWith.

### ðŸ”¹ Nodes:

* **ðŸ”˜ Manual Trigger** (`Manual Trigger`)
  âž¤ This lets you run the workflow manually while testing or for one-time actions.
  ðŸ“ Tip: Great for workflows that don't need to run on a schedule.

* **ðŸ“ Set Technology** (`Set` Node)
  âž¤ You manually define the **technology name** here (e.g., "Shopify").
  âž¤ You can add a field like:

  ```json
  {
    "technologies": "Shopify"
  }
  ```

  âœ… This makes the workflow dynamic â€” you can change the tech each time without editing multiple nodes.

### ðŸ”° What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **Manual Trigger** to run a test or ad-hoc job.
* How to use the **Set Node** to insert static/custom data into the flow.
* How workflows can be made flexible with variables like `technologies`.

## ðŸ”— SECTION 2: **ðŸŒ Fetch + ðŸ§  Process BuiltWith Data**

### ðŸŽ¯ Purpose:

Use the HTTP Request node to connect with the BuiltWith API, and then process the JSON response to extract useful data about the websites.

### ðŸ”¹ Nodes:

* **ðŸŒ Fetch BuiltWith Data** (`HTTP Request`)
  âž¤ Sends a `GET` request to BuiltWithâ€™s API to find websites using the selected technology.
  âž¤ Example URL:

  ```
  https://api.builtwith.com/v20/api.json?KEY=YOUR_API_KEY&TECH=Shopify&START=0
  ```

  ðŸ”‘ Make sure to replace `YOUR_API_KEY` with your real BuiltWith API key.

* **ðŸ§  Extract Site Info** (`Function` Node)
  âž¤ This node parses the JSON response from BuiltWith and pulls out the key fields:

  * `domain`
  * `technology`
  * `firstIndexed`
  * `vertical`
    âž¤ Example output (ready for sheets):

  ```json
  {
    "domain": "www.example-shop.com",
    "technology": "Shopify",
    "firstIndexed": "2024-11-02",
    "vertical": "E-commerce"
  }
  ```

### ðŸ”° What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **HTTP Request** node to work with any public API.
* How to read API documentation (BuiltWith) and form queries.
* How to process complex API responses using a **Function Node** to extract and clean data.

## ðŸ“Š SECTION 3: **ðŸ“„ Log to Google Sheets**

### ðŸŽ¯ Purpose:

Store the clean data into a Google Sheet so that it can be used for:

* Lead generation
* Email campaigns
* Technology tracking
* Competitor research

### ðŸ”¹ Node:

* **ðŸ“„ Log to Google Sheet** (`Google Sheets â†’ Append`)
  âž¤ Appends the parsed data from the previous step to your spreadsheet.
  âž¤ Each row represents a different website using the technology.
  âž¤ Example columns:

  * A: Domain
  * B: Technology
  * C: First Indexed
  * D: Vertical

ðŸ” Youâ€™ll authenticate this once using Google OAuth2 â€” n8n saves the connection for future runs.

### ðŸ”° What a beginner learns here:

* How to connect Google Sheets to n8n
* How to write structured data into spreadsheets
* How to turn API data into actionable CSV-like output

---

## ðŸŒˆ Final Workflow Recap

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[ðŸ”˜ Manual Trigger] --> B[ðŸ“ Set Technology];
    B --> C[ðŸŒ Fetch BuiltWith Data];
    C --> D[ðŸ§  Extract Site Info];
    D --> E[ðŸ“„ Log to Google Sheet];
```

> ðŸ’¡ **Pro Tip:** You can duplicate this workflow and use it for **any API** â†’ process â†’ log pattern. Just swap BuiltWith with another API and it still works!
